answers.author: Edward Shikada
answers.text:
We've seen quite a bit of this as term limits take their toll, and particularly during our big push decade (2000-2010) of capital projects. In that context I'd offer that we notable projects needed to be "refinished" after the fact when there was too much of a rush to meet an incumbent's timeline. Hopefully this isn't your issue with only 60 days to go, but if so it may help to share that it's better to be known as coming back for the ribbon-cutting than known for pushing to an incomplete or inferior product. 
If all else fails, "ceremonial" ribboncuttings and council actions seem to meet some of the need. Good luck!

author: Brian McDougal
text: Recently my city had a changeover of over half of the elected officials.  Since the election the incumbants are pushing hard to "finish" projects before they are off the council.  Any general help out there to give me tools to use for the next 60 days?
title: Interim Council
